feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:03AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY... A couple of waves moving N along a stalled front over the central gulf will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain to the NE gulf coast Tuesday into Wednesday. Rain amounts will range from 1.5 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. The heaviest precipitation will be from Tuesday night through Wednesday morning
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 23 at 2:32AM AKDT until August 23 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds gusting to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...From Black Rapids north. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to gale force will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, persisting into Friday before they diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:22PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Essex, northwestern Addison and west central Chittenden Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elizabethtown, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rutland and west central Windsor Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 203 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall rates are expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Western Rutland; Western Windsor

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 1:55PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Addison and southwestern Washington Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middlebury, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall rates. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 1:38PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following county, Bennington. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York and northwest Vermont, including the following counties, in northern New York, Clinton. In northwest Vermont, Grand Isle.

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 23 at 3:33AM PDT until August 26 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO MIDNIGHT PDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Hot conditions with temperatures in the mid 80s to low 90s expected. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Northwest Interior, Everett and Vicinity, Tacoma Area,
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bellevue and Vicinity; Bremerton and Vicinity; East Puget Sound Lowlands; Everett and Vicinity; Hood Canal Area; Lower Chehalis Valley Area; Seattle and Vicinity; Southwest Interior; Tacoma Area; Western Skagit County; Western Whatcom County
